intro: Rhododendron nagasakianum, commonly known as the Naha rhododendron, is a species native to Japan. It is a deciduous shrub that typically grows to a height of 1–2 meters. The plant produces showy, bell-shaped flowers that are usually pink or white, blooming in late spring. Its leaves are leathery and elliptical, providing a dense canopy. It thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and is often found in mountainous regions.
